The first 12 months had no interest listed. The second 12 months showed 6%. However, I was borrowing $2136 and after adding up how much all payments came to it was $3271. Sorry but I'm not willing to pay $1200 in order to barrow $2100.

So it is buy beware, I will never use this company again,

Review.Titre: This company is literally the worst way…
Review.Contenu: This company is literally the worst way to purchase anything. Their contracts are extremely misleading confusing, show one contract for one term and a second contract for another term, you won't even realize you signed two contracts for the highest interest rates known to financing. I had no idea I was paying $3000 for a $1700 worth in tires. These rates should be illegal, almost 50% for one pair of tires on a car I sold a year ago....I still have another 9 months to go for a car I sold in Feb of 2022. Go ahead and buy something with this company, they'll never be out of your bank account.

Review.Titre: 1.9/5 review on BBB
Review.Contenu: 1.9/5 review on BBB. 1.3/5 on PissedConsumer.This company is not only a scam, but they're scamming their reviews on Trustpilot, which I don't think I feel comfortable believing anymore.This is exploitation at the absolute maximum. I am helping my somewhat financially less literate friend understand this insane agreement he joined with PayTomorrow for a "lease" on his tires, a contract that doesn't need to show an APR because it's a lease but which has an effective APR that is INSANE. It's like tax evasion, dodging transparency to rip financially illiterate people off.I'm filing a complaint with the Illinois Attorney General's Office with my friend against both PayTomorrow and the dealer from which he made this agreement. This is completely insane, and honestly, I can't see how this isn't illegal. It just may be.

Review.Titre: Family Pool Fun/BMI and PayTommorrow.  Go elsewhere if possible!!!
Review.Contenu: Hi I got a loan for a pool from family pool fun this company, Pay Tommorow/BMI.  I have made all my payments on time.  Last month the rep pulled my payment 12-31-19.  This month the money was in the act and I just talked to them yesterday 1-30-20.  I even said that I understand my payment is in process of being pulled.  Rep Taylor replied yes it is.  So today 1-31-20 I get 2 nasty messages that I've been late with several payments.  Your act is in distress status.  I will be getting late charges & bouncing fees.  So I called back and insisted he pull payment and it insisted that he pull it immediately.  Payment went thru no issues.  Taylor never apologized or said I am sorry for his phone messages or rudeness.  This is how they treat people not professional in any way.  I'm highly dissatisfied and disappointed with Pay Tommorrow, BMI, and family pool fun.  PayTommorow could of politely called or asked while I was on the phone with them yesterday. As weve been battling them since the winter pool cover was supposed the armour cover and we got just a thin tarp which is shredded from the Pa winter storms.  In addition to the upgraded pool has gotten a tear which it's been months of communicating thru Jay and the warranty which still neither has been replaced, we have a lot of run around.  A lot of disappointment. We followed directions in building said.  Also sent emails and pictures of problems.Thanks S Eckman Review stays the same your customer service is horrible and useless.  Will pay this loan off.  No real comment from company except for blaming the other part of the company.  We have heard it before.

Review.Titre: Can't make my own payments
Constructive is a matter of…
Review.Contenu: Constructive is a matter of perspective- first of all 🤣Secondly- "interest free" if paid in 90 days, but you still have interest on it....pretty sure that's not "interest free" but OKAYAlso the way you phrased things in the setup is misleading in the way some stores price one item for like $5.00, then like the 2pk is like $10.99 (but they like hide it way better because they advertise it in a way that makes you THINK you're getting a better deal).Your contracts arent very clear in the what you would pay, what you are paying, how long, etc. I literally talked to one of your reps that said she finds people often are confused when reading your contracts. Soooo clearly either that's one of your ways to get money out of people easier, or something.Also one of your reps was kinda short. Told me basically "per my last email" when her last email didn't have anything to do with my question. I had to remind her "didn't you say if I don't have my order by my first payment due date, you'd push it out?" Then she wasn't short with me. She was short in email and over the phone. Last one or two I spoke to were nice though.I just remember Sadie was not so much (remembered her name only because that's my nickname).Next issue I had was that PayTomorrow and the company I bought from DO NOT COMMUNICATE whatsoever. And PayTomorrow doesnt tell you your full outstanding balance online. You have to call each time you need that info.Also cannot pay more than you actually owe at that time without calling.When my order was not only late, but they shipped without customizations I ordered- and reached out after the fact saying they did so- they refused to send the check to PayTomorrow.But they sent me my contract that I have with PayTomorrow before PayTomorrow did 🤣Sadie also told me in my initial call that I would be contacted by one of their reps....that NEVER happened....she thought it was weird they didn't....well I mean the company that you paid wouldn't even send my $500 reimbursement to you for the customizations they failed to honor. So like, clearly this whole this was just simply a terrible experience. Should've just waited a bit longer to pay in full out of pocket, MAJOR regrets even though it's all paid off in the 90 day period. Do not recommend

Review.Titre: VERY VERY EXPENSIVE buyer beware
Review.Contenu: VERY VERY EXPENSIVE buyer beware! I think it’s a great concept in theory, but once adding the interest it’s extremely expensive. Give you an example. I purchased wheels and an exhaust system for $3600. I  Read about “pay tomorrow” thought the payments were definitely manageable. Due to the low monthly payments. I purchased my products Jan 23rd…after looking at the contracts, (VERY confusing) I added up what the final payments were and that $3600 is over $5000 in 2 years. I decided to pay it off. Now consider that I purchased the equipment Jan 23, I paid it off Feb 4. In 12 days they charged me over $200 to pay it off. That comes out to about 30% interest! A high interest credit card at 27% interest rate would have been better to use. I get that people are strapped for cash, but try to look into other option prior to accepting the pay tomorrow contract. I only lost $200 and I make a decent living! But the alternative in paying that high interest is alarming to say the least!

So the online portion pretty much sucks, but the customer support folks are nice.  Please make the online a LOT more user-friendly.

The financed portion interest rate was not too bad and it shouldn't have been as my credit rating is 800. The problem is....unless you pay off the full term amount right off the bat they gouge you with the lease payment ...i ended up paying about 400 dollars more than the product I purchased and still paid off the loan 4 months early.  :(

Seemed to take a longtime to get someone on the phone. The last couple times were not bad, but the first few times were. So maybe they improved that. 2. I called in August, maybe September last year to see about fully paying off my loan. The lady i spoke with said that it would not save me any money by paying early...and that they report to the credit bureau and by paying monthly, it will help my credit. So I opted not to pay it off early. Then, this month, I got an email when they pulled the monthly payment out  saying that I would save roughly $50 by paying it off early. I was pretty upset that this was the case. I could have paid it off earlier and saved quite a bit more money. Maybe it is a training issue, or a way to get more money out of me, I dont know. But it will make me second guess financing with pay tomorrow if there is a next time.
